caption:
The recruitment test for SDSLabs and PAG (@pag_iitr) will be conducted on 29th at APJAKB (L2 001-004) at 8:30PM. Reach the venue by 8:15PM to make necessary arrangements for yourself.

Instructions for Recruitment Test
1. Freshers will be required to get their laptops fully charged for the test. Bring your own chargers and extension cables.
2. We have Geolocation + IP logging built into our platform, being on campus but not at LHC will be considered malpractice.
3. Our test platform has ML-based Audio and video proctoring with real-time face-tracking.
4. You will be required to take the test in fullscreen mode, any attempt at exiting it will be penalized
5. We log all key presses and take regular audio video samples for manual inspection
6. This test is NOT for design recruitments. Designers may skip it.

All the best! See you there :)

PS: @blocsociitr has preponed its test timings from 6PM to 4:30PM. This is to clarify any confusion regarding clashes in test timings.

Fuzzed about the recruitment season, and have a lot of questions?

We can't wait to personally interact with you, hence, we are organizing a meet 'n' greet. Get every little doubt resolved!

Date: 27th March
Venue: SAC OAT First Floor
Time: 9:30PM

Excited for your first college fest? We understand, on considering the numerous requests for an extension, we are extending the deadline of design problem statements to 28th March 11:59 PM.

Visit https://sdslabs.co/designrecruitment to check out problem statements (link in bio)

We are looking forward for your submissions. In case you want any review or help feel free to reach out to us. If you have already submitted, don't worry you can submit it again, the lastest submission will be considered.

Are you a creative problem solver who loves to think outside the box? At SDSLabs Design, we're on the hunt for the ones who can tackle any challenge and come up with neat and effective solutions.

We've got a curated list of thought-provoking problem statements that will put your skills to the test. We're looking for innovative ideas that are both practical and user-friendly. Don't just think outside the box, we encourage you to break down the walls of convention and explore something new!

If you're ready to take on the challenge, head over to our website at http://sdslabs.co/designrecruitment and submit your solutions before March 23rd, 2023. We're excited to see what you come up with. Surprise us with your creative genius!

If you need any assistance or have any questions, reach out to us at chat.sdslabs.co or join our Discord server. Open to all freshers and sophomores!

(All links in bio)

Curious about how to get into SDSLabs? Are there any prerequisites? How should I prepare for the tests and interviews?

As the recruitment season kicks in, we bring to you our Recruitment talk! Clear all your doubts, about the group or development/design in general.

To be held on 12th March, 6:30 PM.

Venue: APJAKB-205

See you there!
Not to dampen your Holi spirits, we're extending Makers' deadline to 12th March 11:59pm, as many of you requested. Excited to see your submissions!

Missed your chance at WoC? Announcing Makers - a month long event where you can work on our curated list of ideas, or bring your own unique ideas to life! Get an opportunity to hone your skills and connect with like-minded individuals. The event is open to freshers and sophomores.

Submission Deadline: 9th March 11:59 PM

Scan the QR or visit the link in our bio to access the ideas list. Connect with us on our open source discord server for any help.

Congratulations to all the shortlisted candidates!

We got an overwhelming number of responses this year! If you weren't selected, fret not for there are more events planned in the coming months. You can still develop your project as a submission for SDSLabs' Makers. And you're more than welcome to drop by on our discord server for help or a quick chat (link in bio).

On popular demand we are officially extending the WOC deadline to 12th February, 2023.

Register now at: https://woc.sdslabs.co/
The winners of @scrappysquirrels Sponsor tracks have been declared. Congratulations to the winning participants!
The results of the Alumni track for Syntax Error 2023 are here! Congratulations to all the winners.

Bring in the heat this winter, for SDSLabs excitedly announces this year‚Äôs edition of Winter of Code! It is our annual month long mentorship program, with a format similar to GSoC.

As a part of WoC, participants are required to submit a proposal for an idea they would like to work on or design a solution to that problem. You are free to choose any problem statement you like, or propose new features on any of the existing SDSLabs projects.

If your proposal is selected, you‚Äôll be mentored by our team under whom you will develop your proposals into reality. Open to all freshers and sophomores. The deadline to submit your proposal is 10th of February, 2023. Selected freshers get a direct interview to SDSLabs!

Register now at: https://woc.sdslabs.co/

PS: Kindly note that WoC invites individual participation ONLY. It is not a team event.

Global Game Jam 2023 is happening soon and SDSLabs IIT Roorkee will be a site for the same!

The Global Game Jam (GGJ) is the world's largest game jam event (game creation) taking place around the world at different sites within the same time period. Think of it as a hackathon focused on game development.

Register now for the event at https://globalgamejam.org/2023/jam-sites/sdslabs
We will be launching the jam on 3rd February at 5 PM and will be live for 48 hours. The mode of communication for this event would be discord and in-person at SDSLabs, so make sure to join the SDSLabs Discord server. (Link in bio)

The event will be preceded by the prep week, where the sponsors and community of GGJ would be providing content to get you ready for the jam.

The theme of GGJ 2023 will be revealed globally prior to the start of the jam on twitch.tv/globalgamejam on 28 Jan 2023

Do check out https://globalgamejam.org/news/meet-sponsors-global-game-jam-2023 where various sponsors like GameMaker, Houdini and Avaturn are providing free licenses for their products and other bonuses!

PS: We know that the freshers would be having their ETEs during these dates, and so you can start working on your games earlier than the jam timing (In the GGJ Prep week - read here: https://globalgamejam.org/important-dates). You will just have to do the final submission between 3-5 February. Keep in mind that this is just for the freshers, we expect other participants to participate in the jam for the stipulated 48 hr timeline.

Register for the event: https://globalgamejam.org/2023/jam-sites/sdslabs

Join our Discord server: https://discord.gg/gThNeXG5j4

Read up about Global Game Jam: https://globalgamejam.org/

If this is your first game jam: https://globalgamejam.org/faq
The results of our title sponsor @routerprotocolofficial ‚Äòs track have been finalised. A hearty congratulations to all the winners!

After days of anticipation, here are the results for Open, Freshman and Design tracks of Syntax Error 2023! Your hard work and innovative ideas have truly impressed us. A shout out to all winners for their outstanding projects.

Thank you to everyone who participated and made this event a success. Keep pushing boundaries and creating amazing things!

Note: Sponsor track winners to be announced soon, stay tuned!

Meet the esteemed judges of Syntax Error 2023, who are also our beloved IITR and SDSLabs Alumni!

Akashdeep Goel (2018 Grad)
Arpit Singla (2018 Grad)
Harkirat Singh (2018 Grad)
Nipun Vashishtha (2020 Grad)

We are honored to have their expertise and insights guiding our competitors!

Are you ready to showcase your skills and creativity?

The moment we've all been waiting for is finally here. Syntax Error is officially kicking off and we couldn't be more excited! Gear up for a weekend of coding, problem-solving and innovation.

The Opening Ceremony will be held:
Venue: MAC Audi
Timings: 13th January, 6:30pm

Compulsory for all participants to attend. We‚Äôll explain all rules, tracks and submission details.

Dean SRIC and Faculty Advisor STC will grace the occasion with their warm presence.

Hoping to see you there!

SDSLabs in collaboration with @routerprotocolofficial come to you with an offline workshop on ‚ÄúHow to make Cross-Chain NFTs.‚Äù

The workshop is compulsory for all IITR Syntax Error participants to attend.

Time: 12th January, 6:30pm
Venue: MAC Auditorium

Do make sure to attend it with all you teammates!

Unlock the secrets of code and discover the limitless potential of development in this hands-on workshop by SDSLabs. Whether you‚Äôre building a website, a mobile app or any other software, this workshop will give you the insight about the tools you need to get started!

Venue: APJAKB-004 (New LHC)

See you there!

Git? GitHub? Ever heard of these terms? Wondering how to collaborate with your team mates for your hackathon project? We‚Äôve got you covered!

SDSLabs is conducting an introductory workshop on Version Control, to help beginners prepare for Syntax Error 2023. Bring your laptops fully charged.

See you there!

Get ready for an exciting design journey with our upcoming lecture on UI/UX, graphic, and game design! Not only will you learn the basics, but we'll also be giving a detailed tutorial on Figma and also be sharing insights on the design track of our upcoming hackathon, Syntax Error.

No prerequisites required. See you there!

Here‚Äôs the line-up of multiple events we‚Äôve planned for you.

Starting today, there are a number of workshops and sessions planned to cater to your interests. See you there!

Get excited! For we announce the sponsor prizes and tracks for Syntax Error 2023. It includes cash, NFTS, subscriptions, schwags, goodies and more!

Visit:
syntax-error-2023.devfolio.co/prizes for more details

The awaited IIT Roorkee Linux Party is here!
To celebrate the spirit of open source and Linux, we will introduce you to open-source software, tools and various other software related to application development, machine learning and information security after installing Linux Ubuntu on your laptops.

This event will provide a platform for all the tech and open-source enthusiasts to meet, discuss, socialize and get bootstrapped to dive into the open-source world.
To get Ubuntu installed, you are requested to bring your own:
* Laptop
* Charger
* Optional: An Ubuntu 20.04 bootable pen drive (or at least a working pen drive if you forget to make it bootable, although it‚Äôs recommended to save time).

The time slot is mentioned in the poster. Please come at the beginning of the slot.

Here is a link to the instructions on creating a bootable pen drive for Ubuntu installation: https://ubuntu.com/tutorials/create-a-usb-stick-on-windows

Refer to this link to check if your disk uses MBR or GPT partition style. Knowing this will ease the process for you: https://pureinfotech.com/check-gpt-mbr-partition-windows-10/

Also, knowing the boot mode the system uses is useful. You can follow this link to read about it: https://itsfoss.com/check-uefi-or-bios/

If you cannot follow any of these, feel free to drop a message at https://chat.sdslabs.co or our Discord server: https://discord.gg/ffh5s8xhRH or just come and attend the party. We will help you get set up.

Note: "Impossible to see, the future is." Having your data backed up is recommended if things go differently than planned. Make sure you do that beforehand, taking your time, as you won‚Äôt like waiting for a long, long time and others waiting for you to finish your backup.

See you soon at the party!

Finally, here we give a shoutout to the rest of our sponsors!

Aztec Network is a privacy shield for Ethereum. Aztec enables affordable, private crypto payments and DeFi interactions via zero-knowledge proofs. Check them out at https://aztec.network/

Balsamiq helps people create software and websites that are easier to use, by creating a low fidelity wireframing tool. Check them out at: https://balsamiq.com/

echo3D is a 3D-focused API and cloud infrastructure to store, update, secure, and stream 3D content for real-time applications. Check them out at https://www.echo3d.com/

Fueler is an online platform to help you showcase your work on the internet. It's like Github but for Generalist individuals. Check them out at https://fueler.io/

Scrappy Squirrels is a collection of 14,000 NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain. Scrappy Squirrels are meant for engineers, designers, and entreprenuers pushing web3 forward. Check them out at https://scrappysquirrels.xyz/

Wolfram is one of the world's most respected computer, web and cloud software companies‚Äîas well as a powerhouse of scientific and technical innovation. Check them out at https://www.wolfram.com/?source=nav

With this, we're pleased to announce @filecoinio as our associate sponsor! Filecoin is a decentralised storage network designed to store humanity's most important information. Check them out at: https://filecoin.io/

You can follow them at:
Slack: https://filecoin.io/slack
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Filecoin

With great pleasure we announce @repl.it as our Associate Sponsor! Replit enables you to build software collaboratively from anywhere in the world, on any device, without spending a second on setup. Check them out at: https://replit.com/

You can also follow them on:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/replit
Discord: https://replit.com/discord
Instagram: https://instagram.com/repl.it
Facebook: https://facebook.com/repl.it

Glad to announce @solana as our Associate Sponsor! Solana is an open source project implementing a new, high-performance, permissionless blockchain. Check them out at: https://solana.com/

You can also follow them at:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/solana
Discord: https://discordapp.com/invite/pquxPsq
Telegram: https://t.me/solana

It's our pleasure to introduce you to our other Associate Sponsor @0xpolygon. Polygon provides scalable & instant Ethereum transactions using sidechains simplifying interactions between users and the decentralized world.
Check them out on: https://polygon.technology/

And you can follow them on:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/0xPolygon
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/0xpolygon/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/0xPolygon.Technology

We are pleased to introduce you to our Associate Sponsor: @devfolioco who are at the forefront of the hacker movement helping organizers host awesome community hackathons and enabling a thriving developer ecosystem around excellent products.
Check them out at http://devfolio.co

You can also follow them on:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/devfolio
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/devfolio
Linkedln: https://www.linkedin.com/company/devfolio
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/devfolioco

We are proud to announce Router Protocol as our Title Sponsor for Syntax Error 2023!
Router Protocol is an infrastructure layer facilitating communication between blockchains. It is a cross-chain protocol that enables fund transfers, asset swaps, cross chain applications and more.

Follow them here:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/routerprotocol
Telegram: https://t.me/routerprotocol
Discord: https://discord.com/invite/yjM2fUUHvN

The much anticipated moment is here! We are glad to announce some of the amazing prizes of Syntax Error 2023.

Freshmen track: Teams consisting of only IITR freshers will be eligible for this track

Open track: All participants from across India are eligible for this track

Design track: We are proud to announce something new this year! All design submissions are eligible for this track. Freshers will be given due consideration for their skills and effort during evaluation.

*All IITR students from the winning teams would be given direct interviews to SDSLabs*

The prizes include cash, goodies, NFTs and more!

Look out for more tracks as we announce them in the coming days.
Register yourself at: https://hackathon.sdslabs.co/

The most awaited event of the year is here and it has something to offer everyone!

SDSLabs is back with its annual flagship event, SYNTAX ERROR - a 36-hour hackathon fuelled by blood, sweat, and of course caffeine. Here you gain the experience of creating a full-fledged product, right from scratch. Dabble in development, design, or a ton of other amazing fields waiting for you to explore them.

Wondering what the prerequisites are? Nada.
An idea, a team, and a passion to create are all you need.

The event is open to ALL STUDENTS across India. The hackathon will be held offline for the IIT-R junta, while students from other parts of the country would be joining us online.

With a prize pool of over 13 lakhs and many other cool prizes, SYNTAX ERROR is much grander than ever. Freshers, sophomores, and third yearites from the top performing teams in IIT-R get a direct interview with SDSLabs.
So pick your brains for some new ideas, for the hacking starts on 13th January 2023.

Register yourself at: https://hackathon.sdslabs.co/

Looking for teammates? Head over to our discord channel and connect with other participants, and keep up with other announcements: https://discord.gg/ffh5s8xhRH

Don't know where to start? We've got you covered: https://github.com/sdslabs/recommends

Stay tuned for further updates!

(Note: IIT-R students are allowed to form teams only with fellow IIT-R students)

Hey Freshers!
Greetings from SDSLabs. Join us this Sunday at 6:30 PM for our official intro talk where you'll get a glimpse of what we do and get to know about our upcoming events.

Until then, get acquainted with the SDSLabs Open Source community on discord. Here you can directly interact with the members, ask doubts and get all relevant updates.

Link to our discord server and chat platform in bio.

SDSLabs feels ecstatic to announce the release of Beast, an Open Source platform to host and manage deployment, lifecycle, and health check of CTF challenges.

Beast provides features like container based isolation, easy configuration, SSH support for challenge instances to name a few.

Beast is the perfect open source alternative to proprietary CTF organizing tools like CTFd and HackTheBox.

Head over to Beast User Documentation (https://beast.sdslabs.co) to know more about it or check out the code (https://github.com/sdslabs/beast)

Made with üíñ by SDSLabs

Intrigued and wanna chat more with the team behind it? (https://chat.sdslabs.co) our Discord (https://discord.gg/dXkVEgTPu9) is open to all visitors and questions üòâ

CTFs are much more than just an event or a competition, they are an adventure. And being able to host them on a great open source platform with ease adds to the fun.

SDSLabs is proud to announce the release of playCTF, a Jeopardy-style CTF challenge deployment and management platform.

Its intuitive and user-friendly deployment interface enables anyone to set up a CTF competition in a couple of minutes.

playCTF incorporates Beast, our CTF creation platform, which provides container-based isolation of each challenge.

Check it out on https://playctf.sdslabs.co.

Experience playCTF on the playCTF playground (https://playground-playctf.sdslabs.co), or have a peek at the source code (https://github.com/sdslabs/playctf).

Also, check out the Beast GitHub repository (https://github.com/sdslabs/beast) and the
Beast User Documentation (https://beast.sdslabs.co),

Give it a chance, and Beast will surely live up to it's name for you!

Made with üíñ by SDSLabs

Intrigued and wanna chat more with the team behind it?

(https://chat.sdslabs.co) and our Discord (https://discord.gg/dXkVEgTPu9) is open to all visitors and questions üòâ

After running through 750+ applications with a fine tooth comb, and interviewing more than 150 applicants, we are thrilled to announce results of Recruitment Drive 2022. We wholeheartedly welcome new members to the family.

Can‚Äôt see your name here? Fret not, you can always keep working on exciting things and drop your resume at contact@sdslabs.co.in

The recruitment test for SDSLabs, PAG, and DSG will be conducted today at the old LHC at 6:45PM. Reach the venue by 6:35PM to make necessary arrangements for yourself.

Instructions for Recruitment Test
- Freshers will be required to get their laptops fully charged for the test and some blank sheets for rough work.
- Those at home will be allowed to give the test online. Stay tuned to our discord at 6:30PM. Find invitation link in bio.
- Our test platform has ML-based Audio and video proctoring with real-time face-tracking.
- You will be required to take the test in fullscreen mode, any attempt at exiting it will be penalized
- We log all key presses and take regular audio/video samples for manual inspection
- We have Geolocation + IP logging built into our platform, being on campus but not at LHC will be considered malpractice
- If any issues arise contact us in person (offline) or DM us on discord or chat.sdslabs.co

The campus has just opened up and we're certainly not ones to rain on your parade. So, in the wake of the upcoming comedy show, we're postponing the recruitment test, date and venue will be announced soon.
For the folks at home, you'll be allowed to give the paper online, but be warned, if you're on campus we'll know.
So, have fun, cause we know we certainly will.

After much discussion and debate, the recruitment test will be held on March 28th, at 6:15 PM at the New LHC.

Those of y'all who won't be able to give the test offline are requested to DM us on Facebook.

Please note, you will be required to bring your laptops for the test.

Based on multiple requests, we have decided to extend the makers 2022 submission deadline by 2 more days!
Make sure to put your project code in a Github repository and submit your project details on https://forms.gle/vAmi4dWKmugg8tEy5 before 26th March 2022, 23:59
We can‚Äôt wait to see what you came up with!

Next up on our Dev lecture series, join us as we talk about How the "NodeJS" Event Loop works.
And in a first, after 2 years of online classes and virtual interactions, we're finally taking our lectures the way it's meant to be taken, offline and on campus. So, join us at the LHC at 6:30 PM on 24th March for our very first offline lecture in a long time.

We're pleased to announce Lumos Labs as our Associate Sponsor.

Lumos Labs is a Singapore-based web3 innovation management firm that specializes in running technology open innovation programs and evangelizing global web3 opportunities for students and developers in India.
As part of their innovation programs, Lumos Labs has the NEAR program, that all participants would benefit from. Some benefits include verifiable certificates that you can add to your resume and on LinkedIn

The 7 day NEAR education program is an exclusive course curated to help individuals make
their debut in the Web3 space.
During this course we will practice:
‚óè perceiving web 3 in the context of human history
‚óè reading contract code in Rust and AssemblyScript
‚óè writing contracts using Rust and AssemblyScript
‚óè testing contracts using unit and simulation tests
‚óè deploying contracts and a sensible user interface

Here is the registration link for the NEAR Education Program: https://forms.gle/b85eqSkp7aPTXuQN6

For More information: https://www.lumoslabs.co/neareducation

The eagerly-awaited moment is finally here. The prizes of Syntax Error 2022 are:

Overall Track
‚Çπ10,000 for first prize
‚Çπ5000 for second prize
‚Çπ3000 for third prize

Freshmen Front
This track is only for IITR students. To be eligible for this track you need to have at least 2 first yearites in your team. The prizes are as follows:
‚Çπ7000 for first prize
‚Çπ3000 for second prize
The first yearites of all the winning teams will be called for a direct interview at SDSLabs.

Alumni Track
This year we have a special category, thanks to the alumni of SDSLabs who have graciously decided to sponsor this track.

Makers is officially live!
You can find the link to the problem statements in our bio
So? Whatcha waiting for? Get cracking already.

Note: Designers can work on the recruitment problem statements that were released earlier. More details are in the drive link above.

And help will always be given to anyone who asks. Feel free to ping us at chat.sdslabs.co or join our discord server if you have any queries or are in need of assistance.

Some Frequently Asked Questions:
What is Makers?
Makers is a 15-day program, and an opportunity to showcase your inner developer. You come up with your own idea and build it, right from the ground up

Who can participate?
It‚Äôs most suitable for 1y as an alternative to WoC and as an entry point to recruitments into SDSLabs, but people from other years are welcome to participate.

What can I make?
Anything! All you need is an idea and the will to complete it. If you don't have an idea, we've released a couple of problem statements above, so you can work on them too

Where do I have submit my project?
We'll announce these details shortly

SDSLabs is delighted to announce @thedapplist as an Associate Sponsor for Syntax Error. We are glad to have a collaboration with them which is helping us organize such a wonderful hackathon for hackers and web3 devs around the world!

The Dapp List is building an ecosystem to Curate the Web3 Adoption. They are striving to bring users, developers, and investors together and provide them with a platform to interact and collaborate. This will facilitate the next wave of adoption for Web3 Explore the world of web3 with The Dapp List. Wanna know more, check out our Facebook post for links to their discord server
Spead the word, Syntax Error is now Open to All students across India üéâ. Check out https://hackathon.sdslabs.co/ and https://syntaxerror2022.devfolio.co/ for updated details and exciting tracks!

As a part of the recruitments, we are happy to announce Makers!
Makers is an opportunity for you to show us your inner developer where you work on an awesome project on your own, in 15 days.

And what do you work on? Well, that‚Äôs up to you! Come up with a project based on an idea that you like.

Don‚Äôt have any ideas? Fret not for we have a few problem statements that you can work on.

We are eager to see what everyone brings to the table, and if your project shows us the developer within you, then you will get a direct entry to the interview round of our March 2022 Recruitments. The link to the Makers‚Äô problem statements will be out tomorrow at 6PM.

Note: Designers can work on the problem statement that was released a few days ago as part of the recruitments.

We‚Äôre really excited to see what everyone brings to our table. If you have any queries or are in need of assistance with your project, feel free to ping us at chat.sdslabs.co or hop in on our discord server.

Hello IITR Junta!
Are you a problem solver? Do you love thinking outside the box, or more importantly, as if there's no box at all?

We at SDSLabs Design are on the hunt for the most creative minds who can persevere through any problem and develop neat and effective solutions.

Given below is a curated list of problem statements from the great minds of the peeps here at SDSLabs Design. Check em out and send in your submission before 20th March, 2022.

Link: http://sdslabs.co/designrecruitment

We're really excited to see you put on your problem solving hats and design user friendly solutions. In case of any doubts, do ping us at chat.sdslabs.co or join our discord server.
Discord Server Link: https://discord.gg/C73urt7EqX

We're pleased to introduce you to our associate sponsor echo3D (www.echo3D.co), it is a cloud platform for 3D/AR/VR that provides tools and server-side infrastructure to help developers & companies quickly build and deploy 3D/AR/VR games, apps, and content.

Stay updated on our Discord server (https://discord.gg/J3pvfPkmNr) for some exciting announcement during the hackathon.

We're pleased to introduce you to our associate sponsor @Tezos. Tezos is a technology for deploying a blockchain capable of modifying its own set of rules with minimal disruption to the network through an on-chain governance model.
Check it out üëâ https://tezos.com/

We're pleased to introduce you to our sponsor Celo (@celoorg), a global payments infrastructure that makes financial tools accessible to anyone with a mobile phone. Check them out üëâ https://celo.org

With this, we're really excited to announce our Associate Sponsor: @oreillymedia
Watch out for more updates on our discord server as we have an exciting announcement for all hackers.

O'Reilly is an American learning company established that publishes books, produces tech conferences, and is an online learning platform. Many have known them for their high-quality books on various technical topics and have helped a ton of developers all around the world.
Check them out at https://www.oreilly.com/

Brownie points to those eagled eyed enough to see this coming. With this, we present to you our latest iteration of our annual flagship event. Syntax Error - a 36 hour hackathon that's fueled by blood, sweat, maybe caffeine where you have the experience of working on a full-fledged product, right from ideation to its conception using code.

This Hackathon has been the starting point for a lot of budding tech enthusiasts, but more importantly, it's the perfect playground for everyone experimenting with development, design, and a ton of amazing fields. The pre-requisites? None. All you need is an idea, a kickass team, your ability to google stuff and assemble everything into your final product. But more importantly, learn and have fun. Registrations are now open.So head on over to https://hackathon.sdslabs.co/ to register.

More details will be announced in the coming days, so stay tuned!

Congratulations to all the shortlisted candidates!
We got an overwhelming number of responses this year. We thoroughly enjoyed going through your proposals and we genuinely wish that we could've mentored all of you. But given the limited resources that we have, this could not be.
If you didn't get shortlisted, fret not for there are more events planned in the coming months. You can still develop your project as a submission for SDSLabs' Makers. And you're more than welcome to drop by on our discord server for help or a quick chat. We're also reachable at chat.sdslabs.co

Considering the numerous requests for an extension of the deadline, the deadline for Winter of Code proposal submission has been extended to 8th Feb, 11:59pm.
Also, we have filtered spam from the submission database and added a way to verify if your submission has been successful. Head over to http://woc.sdslabs.co/checksubmission and check if your submission was successful.

Hey there!

Have you ever used Mozilla Firefox or VSCode? Did you know that a large part of the software you use every day is open-source, code of which is designed to be publicly accessible.

GSoC is one of the famous open-source programs where students gain exposure to real-world software development. We are conducting a GSoC talk on 6th Feb where we will discuss GSoC and other open-source programs. Freshers, as well as sophomores, are encouraged to join.

Hey folks
We understand that some of y'all would not have been able to attend our recruitment talk. Fear not! cause you can find the recording on our Twitch channel: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1286572950

We'd also recommend being on the lookout for updates on the recruitment website: https://join.sdslabs.co and our Facebook/Instagram page!

Ever got the urge to dig deep into the world behind tiny glowing screens of your devices? Ever wondered how your 10 minute break ends up in hours of scrolling on Instagram?

We are bunch of ever curious minds exploring way through technology and looking forward to welcoming new members into the family. Learn all about it in our Recruitment Talk on 4th February at 6:30 PM at https://www.twitch.tv/sdslabs.

Hope to see you there!

Though winter's end draws near, a few surprises still remain. We're very excited to finally announce this year's edition of Winter of Code. Our annual month-long mentorship program, with the format being similar to GSoC and other mentorship programs.

As part of the program, candidates will have to submit a proposal for an idea that they would like to work on or design a solution to a problem. If selected, you'd be taken under the wings of our designers and developers, who would help you make your ideas a reality. The program's open to students of the first year and second year. With the proposal submission deadline on 7th February 2022.

Register now at https://woc.sdslabs.co/

Global Game Jam starts at 5 PM today. Join us for a small opening ceremony at 5 PM on our discord for the theme reveal and to share some general guidelines. See you there!
If you haven't registered yet,
Register at: https://globalgamejam.org/2022/jam-sites/sdslabs
Discord: https://discord.gg/hh6gmEBWJm

Now that the Game Dev lecture is done, GGJ starts on 28th and we'd advise you to start forming teams. There's no minimum or maximum limit on the team size. Fret not if you can't find one, just drop a message on the GGJ-team-finder channel on our discord and find a team of your own! Also, register on the GGJ site if you haven't until now. PS : Exceptional submissions from first yearites might just bag them a direct interview to SDSLabs!
Discord : https://discord.gg/hh6gmEBWJm

Aren't video games the ultimate mixture of art and technology? While playing, do you ever stop to wonder how are these games are even made? Do you wish of being an indie game developer? Do you - well, want to make games? If yes, then join us for a fun session on Game Development and Game Design on 26th January'22 at 6:30 PM.

See you at https://www.twitch.tv/sdslabs.

The multitude of projects and opportunities that you'd get here on campus can be overwhelming for a fresher. Especially when you haven't gotten the chance to meet your peers and seniors in person.

From basic questions like "What is web development, open-source and git" to doubts that you'd want to ask to figure out what you want to explore, drop by at our "Ask Me Anything" Session on Monday, 24th January from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM to clear your queries or even just to say hi.

Join us on our discord server: https://discord.gg/gThNeXG5j4

Global Game Jam 2022 is happening soon and SDSLabs IIT Roorkee will be a site for the same!

The Global Game Jam (GGJ) is the world's largest game jam event (game creation) taking place around the world at different sites within the same time period. Think of it as a hackathon focused on game development.

We will be launching the jam on 28th January at 5:00 PM. The mode of communication for this event would be discord so make sure to join the SDSLabs Discord server.

Scan the QR to register and more details.

Hello Design Enthusiasts!

Balsamiq Cloud is the perfect tool for designing and reviewing user interfaces online. Check them out: https://www.sketch.com/

Here's the big announcement we have for the junta of IITR, especially the freshers. SDSLabs is back with our annual hackathon, Syntax Error 2021.

What is a hackathon?
A hackathon is a short, fast-paced event (typically of 1-2 days) in which participant teams think of an innovative idea and develop a prototype of the envisioned product. The event concludes with a presentation of the product to the judges in an attempt to convince them that this can be the next big thing. And if you are successful you get those sweet prizes.
But prizes aren't the main attraction of a hackathon, it is the satisfaction you get from seeing your code running, the lessons you learn from what is not running, the excitement you get from trying out a new thing, the fun interactions between participants in helping each other out and a lot more.

Syntax Error 2021 will be a 36-hour hackathon starting on 8th January 2021. You can Register and check out the FAQ section on https://hackathon.sdslabs.co/

Looking for teammates?
Join this FB Group to find and connect with more participants https://www.facebook.com/groups/198447694257165

Stay tuned here for further updates!
A few years ago this was just an idea. Now it's a way of life. It's been here before, but now it is even more magnificent. This unsurprisingly grand event knocks on our doors once again..

"Change is the only constant in life." - Heraclitus

The above quote very succinctly describes the ever-evolving world of software, and to make sure you don't get left behind, we too, have to keep on evolving.

We at SDSLabs have always sought to keep ourselves updated with the latest trends in the software sector and we felt the need to evolve and re-brand our identity to reflect our vision more clearly. Hence here we are with a brand new logo and a completely revamped design system.

Check out our new portfolio at https://sdslabs.co
and team page at https://team.sdslabs.co

Do you want to become a developer or a designer at SDSLabs as a first-year student?
Do you want to make a difference and lead the technical innovation movement in IITR? Great! Because we have good news for you.

SDSLabs goes recruiting during the winter! To get answers to all your queries about how to get into SDSLabs, we are organizing our Recruitment Talk on 6th November 2019 at 6 PM in MAC Auditorium. We will also announce our upcoming events planned for the IITR junta during this winter season.

See you at the talk!

Join us this Friday in the Mac Audi to know more about what we and our sister groups (DSG, PAG, and InfoSecIITR) do, and get a sneak peek into our upcoming endeavours and the exciting events we have lined up across the semester for you.
